intro: Erysimum pubicalyx, commonly known as the woolly wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, bloom in early spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erysimum pubicalyx thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
